titleStmt.title: Pearls of eloquence, or, The school of complements Wherein ladies, gentlewomen, and schollars, may accommodate their courtly practice with gentile ceremonies, complemental, amorous, and high expressions of speaking, or writing of letters. By VV. Elder, Gent.
titleStmt.author: Elder, William, fl. 1680-1700.
J. G. (John Gough), fl. 1640, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for T. Lock, and are to be sold by Henry Eversden, at the Grey-Hound in St. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: A reissue, with cancel bifolium replacing title page, of the 1655 edition.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

place.placeName: the Grey-Hound in St. Pauls Church-yard
